top: Micron Technology Inc. shares slid in the extended session Tuesday after the chip maker noted challenges going forward after nearly doubling its profit and adding more than $1 billion in sales from last year thanks to strong cloud and consumer sales during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Micron MU, +1.99% said it expects adjusted fiscal first-quarter earnings of 40 cents to 54 cents a share on revenue of $5 billion to $5.4 billion, while analysts had forecast earnings of 66 cents a share on revenue of $5.27 billion.
Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) shares were taking a hit late Tuesday afternoon, following the company's release of its fourth quarter of fiscal 2020 results after market hours.

Micron stock slides as weak outlook foll: “Unless industry capex moderates from current levels or demand exceeds our expectations, we see a risk of challenging NAND industry profitability levels.”
“Enterprise demand is weak and some of our customers may be carrying higher inventory,” Zinsner said.
Micron Technology Falls After Hours Desp: However, Micron's guidance fell short of expectations.
Investors are adjusting to this less sunny proximate future for the company.
